made 5 edits between February 8, 2020 and February 8, 2020.

div.p:
[postmark stamp]
SAVANNAH GEORGIA
NOVEMBER 4 1943
230 PM
[/postmark stamp]

NAME & RANK : S / Sgt. Ann Smith
ORGANIZATION : WAC [Det?]
[strike]BRANCH OF SERVICE[/strike] A. 700158
HUNTER FIELD, [strike]SAVANNAH,[/strike] GEORGIA

Mrs. G. W. Carlstead
431 Alleghaney
Vallejo, California

Can you imagine me being wide
enough awake at seven o'clock in the
morning to write a letter. But believe it
or not I get up at six o'clock every morning
and am always awake by then. The
Army has done something for me, taught
me how to get up.
I sent a box the other day to G.W.
That jacket was given to me but they won't
let me wear it so thought G.W. might be
able to. I just stuck that towel in to fill
up the box. What do you kids want
for Xmas? It isn't very far off now. I will
have to work Thanksgiving & [strike]Ne[/strike] Xmas &
New Years. I think I'll get a furlough
about February. Wish I could come out

the Dr. yet? Is Jerry walking now? They
will be so grown up I won't know them
when I do get to see them. Take good
care of them and let's hope the war
will soon be over so we can all be
together again. Write often.
Love,
Mother.
P.S. I got my insurance straightened out.

there. That is if you are still there This
base is filling up again. 11,000 men here.
Have to kick them out of your way to
walk. If you fail to salute an officer
into the guard house you go, and I am
going to have to go to Headquarters
this morning. I was talking about a
transfer and you would have thought
I was asking for some one's right arm.
So now I am going to get a day off
during the week, just have to open up
every other morning & stay late every other
night. They don't want me to leave here.
Captain Dragnett who is in charge of Quartermaster
here wants me to go to DCS and take up
a Quarter master course. But I am satisfied
the way I am.
How is Jimmy & are you taking him to
